om.helper
Class SimpleQuestion1

java.lang.Object
  om.stdquestion.StandardQuestion
      om.helper.SimpleQuestion1
All Implemented Interfaces:
Question
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlankQuestion
public abstract class SimpleQuestion1
extends StandardQuestion

Base class for simple questions that have an input box and an answer box (simultaneously visible) and match certain other 'standard' requirements in their XML.

Specifically, the XML must contain the following component IDs:

  • inputbox - box that contains controls into which user enters their answers
  • answerbox - box that contains information about the answer, e.g. was it right or not
  • wrong - component within answerbox, shown only if answer is wrong
  • still - component within answerbox, shown only if answer is wrong and it's not the first time
  • right - component within answerbox, shown only if answer is right
  • pass - component within answerbox, shown only if user passed
  • feedback - component within answerbox, shown only if getFeedbackID() returns something other than null.
There should be examples matching this pattern in the documentation.

setMaxAttempts

protected void setMaxAttempts(int iMaxAttempts)
Set the maximum number of attempts permitted. After that it will tell you the answer. The default is 3.

Parameters:
iMaxAttempts - Number of permitted attempts

actionOK

public void actionOK()
              throws OmException
Callback that Om calls when the user clicks the 'OK' button after seeing the response to their answer. This either ends the question, or hides the answer box and re-enables the input box for another attempt.

Throws:
OmException

isRight

protected abstract boolean isRight(int attempt)
                            throws OmDeveloperException
Override this method to check whether the user's answer is correct or not.

This is a simple right/wrong flag. To provide feedback as to how they were wrong, you should call setFeedbackID() [probably only for wrong answers and certain attempts].

Parameters:
attempt - Question attempt (1 for first, 2 for second, etc.)
Returns:
True if the user is right; false if they are wrong.
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

setScore

protected void setScore(boolean bRight,
                        boolean bPass,
                        int iAttempt)
                 throws OmDeveloperException
Override this method to change the scoring. The method should call getResults().setScore.

Default scoring is out of 3 points: 3 for correct answer first time, 2 second time, 1 third time, 0 for fail or pass.

Parameters:
bRight - True if user was right (rather than passing/failing)
bPass - True if user passed on question
iAttempt - Attempt number (1 = first attempt)
Throws:
OmDeveloperException

setFeedbackID

protected void setFeedbackID(java.lang.String sID)
Sets the feedback ID for current question attempt. Should be called from within isRight().

Feedback works as follows:

  • You must have a component with id 'feedback'. This component will be hidden if this method returns null, and shown otherwise.
  • If you return "" then no further action is taken. Otherwise you must have multiple components with IDs, directly inside the 'feedback' component. These will all be hidden except the one named by the return value. Components which don't have IDs will be unaffected.

Parameters:
sID - ID of component to use for feedback. May be null if there is no feedback this time, or an empty string to display just the 'feedback' component without messing with its children

doAdditionalAnswerProcessing

protected void doAdditionalAnswerProcessing(boolean bRight,
                                            boolean bWrong,
                                            boolean bPass,
                                            int attempt)
                                     throws OmDeveloperException
Override this method if you want to do any additional processing with the user's answer. This is called after all default processing.

Parameters:
bRight - True if user was right
bWrong - True if they were wrong
bPass - True if they passed
attempt - Attempt number (1 is first attempt)
Throws:
OmDeveloperException
